fields.description:
In the file logging view (e.g., right-click on a committed file and choose “Log Selected…”), it appears that the commit date column uses some kind of American-style date formatting in complete disregard for the locale configured in System Preferences.

See attached screen shot (SourceTree in background, System Prefs in foreground). The date formatting is inconsistent.
fields.summary: File log view disregards system locale for date formatting

fields.description:
Prior versions of SourceTree would use the system date and time format in the commit list. As of 2.4, it appears to be hard-coded to US format "Nov  30, 2016, 1:51 PM", even though my system would display this as "30 Nov 2016, 13:51".

Please restore previous behavior.
fields.summary: System date/time format preference not honored in 2.4

fields.description: When searching for authors I get results for peoples last names if they contain no special characters. My name starts with the letter Ö, and I get no results when searching for myself.
fields.summary: No results when searching for my last name (starting with the letter Ö)

fields.description:
Currently, if you double click on a given commit that is the head of a remote branch, sourcetree will checkout and track that branch, at it's head. Nice.

However, if you already have a local tracking branch, it throws an error. And you have to go and find that branch in your list on the left, double click that, and then pull the branch to get it up to date with where you actually want to be.

My feature request is that if you double click on a commit that is the head of a remote branch, and a local tracking branch exists, it will checkout the local branch, without erroring. Additionally, if the local branch is not up to date with remote, it will give you an option to pull the branch, in the one operations.

Thanks for considering this.
fields.summary: Checkout local branch, and automatically pull, when double click on a branch in the history view

fields.description:
From: [https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/STSP-5473]

We've experienced some crippling performance issues using SourceTree as of late, where SourceTree will soft-lock for long periods of time (5+ minutes).

After some amount of effort we were able to get back to a working state by 

(a) Switching diff/merge tools from FileMerge to Beyond Compare

(b) Adding *.prefab and *.meta to the visual diff ignore list.

Different combinations of the above worked for different people.

Some context:
 * We're using Unity to build a game, with about 15 developers.  
 * We generate tons of commits every day with a large number of files, many of which are text files (e.g. unity prefab and meta files).  
 * Only recently did SourceTree start giving us problems.  Rebooting/reinstalling/etc didn't matter.  Only when we changed the diff/tool and expanded the visual diff ignore list did things return to a workable state.
fields.summary: Performance problems with SourceTree using FileMerge

fields.description:
Seen in: STSP-5457

 

"Greetings,
Source Tree isn't starting for me. When I start it I get the attached dialog.

title: Error loading hosting services 
 Text:Unable to load list of hosted service accounts, please report thisto support.

(note: thisto is your typo  !https://support.atlassian.com/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png|width=16,height=16!

Do I have a corrupted profile or something?

Thanks,
 Bob"
fields.summary: SourceTree not starting

fields.description:
I could push/pull/clone fine before the update (around 20 mins ago) - via Sourcetree, terminal, and the Github app for mac.

Now that I've updated to 2.4, I can't push/pull/clone. I can't even push/pull/clone via terminal.

If I try, I get:
 *remote: Repository not found.* 
 *fatal: repository 'https://github.com/XXX/XXX.git/'* not found (where XXX = removed personal info)

 I've tried with multiple repo's, all of which I could access fine less than 20 mins ago, before the update.

UPDATE: I've been able to restore access via terminal by re-adding my SSH
fields.summary: Can't push/pull/clone after update to 2.4 (88)

fields.description:
Add built-in support for Meld diff/merge tool to SourceTree in the Diff options/preferences dialog.

I currently have to set `External Diff Tool` to `Custom` and the following.

Command = /Applications/Meld.app/Contents/MacOS/Meld

Arguments = "$LOCAL" "$REMOTE"

The above could possibly do with some back-slahses for robustness?

For `External Merge Tool`:

Arguments = "$LOCAL" "$BASE" "$REMOTE" --auto-merge --output="$MERGED"
fields.summary: Add support for Meld diff/merge tool

fields.description:
When dragging SourceTree's main window around on my Mac (macOS Sierra 10.12.2, but this also happened on earlier versions), it often starts jerking around erratically. One consistent way of reproducing this is as follows.
 # Click into the *top* of the window's title bar. 
 # Drag the mouse into the menu bar to trigger Exposé. (You have to make sure to click very close to the top of the window's title bar, when clicking further down in the title bar and then dragging the mouse to the top of the screen, Exposé is not triggered, which is also a bug by the way.)
 # Continue moving the mouse, the window will now start jerking around erratically.

It also happens regularly when simply dragging the window around normally as illustrated in the enclosed screen recording. Here it seems to be triggered by the side of the SourceTree window lining up with the side of the Finder window behind it.
fields.summary: Strange behaviour when dragging main window

fields.description:
If you right click on a file and select "Log Selected...", and then, in the left-bottom view, click on a sha to the right of "Parents", a macOS "There is no application set to open the URL rev://\{sha}" is presented. Of course the expected behavior would be to go to the History view with that commit visible and selected, just like what happens if you double click on a commit in the left-top view of the "Log Selected..." window.

 

This happens on Version 2.4 (78).
fields.summary: Clicking on parent commit sha in file Log popup opens macOS "no app can open this URL" dialog
a
Add expand all button for tree view mode  in both Stage/Unstage files section

fields.description: This happens immediately after what reported in issue [#SRCTREE-4320]; when I paste the repository URL inside the clone mask field and then switch focus to the next field, the validation never starts, resulting in the fact that I cannot clone any repository this way.
fields.summary: When pasting a repository URL inside the clone mask, validation doesn't start

fields.description: When cloning a repository from the SourceTree app "Remote" tab, the repository URL field inside the mask is not populated, I have to right click on the repository beforehand and select "Copy clone URL to clipboard" and then paste it inside the clone mask field, I don't know if it's an intended behaviour but I remember it wasn't like this in the previous versions.
fields.summary: Repository URL field is not populated when cloning from SourceTree app "Remote" tab

fields.description: When generating SSH keys in the Welcome Wizard, these keys are not added to the SSH agent, resulting in a "Error: Permission denied (publickey)" when trying to clone a repository.
fields.summary: Generated SSH keys are not added to the SSH agent

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is not possible to clone remote repositories on Sourcetree anymore

In the repository browser, when a user clicks on "Remote" in order to find their Bitbucket and GitHub accounts -- with the credentials for both accounts are correct and all repositories listed. When clicking "clone" to clone any of them, the user gets a popup titled "Clone a repository" and all of the values are blank (Source URL, Destination Path, and Name). Even when trying to fill in the Source URL manually, there is always a warning in the bottom-left corner saying "This is not a valid source path / URL".

Trying to clone a repo by clicking 'New Repository' -> Clone from URL, then inserting a valid remote URL will fail as well... making it impossible to clone a repo on Sourcetree.

 !Sourcetreebug.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SourceTree no longer validates repo URLs correctly -- making it impossible to clone a repo
An error occurred while extracting the archive. Please try again later.

fields.description:
When the app is in full-screen mode, and a commit is being prepared, pressing the Escape key does not abort the commit editing session but rather instead moves the app out of full-screen mode.

(Compare with the correct behaviour when a commit is being made in regular windowed mode.)
h3. STR:
 # Put app into full-screen (ctrl-cmd-F)
 # Begin a commit (cmd-shift-C)
 # Press Esc.

Expected: commit is aborted.

Actual: app reconfigures itself to a non-full-screen window; commit continues.
h3. Design note:

At present, when in full-screen mode but _not_ making a commit, pressing Esc will also bring the app out of full-screen. My preference would be for this _never_ to occur; pressing the full-screen shortcut (ctrl-cmd-F) a second time already affords this behaviour.

The current design overloads the Esc key context-dependently, for arguably little gain.
fields.summary: Pressing Esc does not abort commit while running in full-screen
Error extracting update archive: 2.3.2 --> 2.4

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{quote}While working on a hg extension I've noticed that if SourceTree is using the embedded hg that sets a PATH in which the HG executable can't be found. It may think that the repository is a git repository and set the paths accordingly.
{quote}
The output of {{echo $HG - $Path}} on commit hooks shows:
{code:java}hg_local - /Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/bin:/Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/bin:/Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/gitflow:/Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/git-lfs:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/usr/bin
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable _Always Display Full Console Output_ option
 # Navigate to Mercurial Repository
 # Add the code below in {{.hgrc}}
{code:java}[hooks]
commit = echo $HG - $PATH
{code}
 # Make a commit on the mercurial repository
 # Observe the full console output
 !Mercurial.PNG!
 # "hg_local" can't be located in the given PATH


- STSP-5392
fields.summary: SourceTree uses Git Path on mercurial repository

fields.description:
In my normal working environment I review multi-file changes selecting files or hunks to stage.

But this is nearly impossible with SourceTree, because the diff view keeps refreshing and every time it refreshes the file and line position and scroll position. For me, this is happening every 5 or so seconds. As you can imagine, many a swear word gets uttered during this process.

In my search for an answer, I've seen various bug reports for SourceTree that seem to get shuffled about and closed or not necessarily addressed. Ultimately there are three contributing factors:
 # Something is changing files
 # SourceTree refreshes when ANY file change occurs, even ignored files
 # SourceTree looses position information when a refresh occurs

Now although item 1 is not SourceTree's fault the consequences given 2 and 3 are really bad. With the greatest respect, there have been so many people who hit these issues that I would strongly suggest 2 and 3 are addressed.

For item 1, I eventually found out what was the problem in my case. I develop apps using meteor ([http://meteor.com)|http://meteor.com%29/] and in development mode it runs a mongodb database, which periodically writes diagnostic info (*.meteor/local/db/diagnostic.data/metrics.interim* to be precise). The whole .meteor folder is in my .gitignore file.

The simple answer of course is that I shut the meteor down while reviewing changes, but that is simply not a realistic option as it would destroy my productivity. I also haven't found a way to disable the mongodb diagnostics.

SourceTree has the ability to disable automatic refreshes, and although this might seem like a great option - as a user it isn't. You only have to miss some changes that shouldn't have been submitted ... etc. and you may end up looking for another job.

One more workable compromise option would be to have an automatic refresh that only kicks in when the SourceTree app gains focus. For most people this would catch manual code changes.

Another suggestion is to have refresh still detect changes, and display a 'Changes detected. Refresh now.' button in the header/toolbar.  So that the user is alerted, but not necessarily interrupted.

The best option of course is that file detection skips ignored files/directories (fix issue 2). It clearly should. I've seen a comment in one of the issues suggesting that it might be inefficient, but the consequences are too impactful not to, and the actual refresh has to do that check anyway (albeit inside git).

Maybe the git refresh (git status command at least) can be executed before fully committing to the UI refresh. If the existing view doesn't currently have that file, and the git status doesn't list it - ignore the file change. Even better, use the *git check-ignore* command which seems perfect for this scenario.

Alternatively, do the refresh in the background, and if the result is identical to the UI's existing state - return without changing anything.
fields.summary: Sourcetree refreshes when ignored files change making reviewing diffs virtually impossible

fields.description:
I have a file in the root of my project called:

{{backup/gmail/getmail/oldmail-imap.gmail.com-993-a@b.c-[Gmail].All Mail}}

This is a typical Getmail log file / config file.

When I add this file to gitignore, it will create the following entry in my repository's gitignore file:

{{oldmail-imap.gmail.com-993-a@b.c-[Gmail].All Mail}}

This does not stop git or Sourcetree from detecting the file as new.

Please see the screenshot attached. I've censored the email address. Let me know if I forgot to include vital information.

fields.description:
This is similar to the a previous issue here resolved as obsolete. textconv diff not generated https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1416

However, it still affects all recent and new versions and we would really want to see this fixed.

I've created a custom branch to demonstrate this: [https://github.com/krunk4ever/localizablestrings]

First you'll have to set up your environment to correctly diff *.strings as UTF-16 files by calling:
 * {{git clone git@github.com:krunk4ever/localizablestrings.git}}
 * {{git config diff.localizablestrings.textconv "iconv -f utf-16 -t utf-8"}}
 * {{git config diff.localizablestrings.binary false}}

The git repository above contains a .gitattributes files which properly mark *.strings as localizablestrings so whenever git attempts to diff them, they'll treat them as non-binary files and use textconv.

 

Next call 
 * {{git show c64354f1d4945ed4325443923f937450dc45510a}}
 * {{git show f2d3035acce2e4059fe14e124913b0cfd0cefe9f}}

and you should see what the attached shows:
 * 1-diffing-comitted-new-file.log
 * 2-diffing-committed-edited-file.log

 

However, if you open up SourceTree and view those 2 commits, you don't see anything:
 * 1-diffing-comitted-new-file.png
 * 2-diffing-committed-edited-file.png

 

The time that textconv is actually honored is for uncommitted changes:
 * 1-diffing-uncomitted-new-file.png
 * 2-diffing-uncommitted-edited-file.png
fields.summary: diff textconv is ignored when diffing commits

fields.description:
When trying to refresh list of branches, push to or pull from repo I repeatedly get the prompt for authentication. Even with a valid personal access token I ultimately fail to complete the operation.

When I refer to latest released 2.3 revision I do not get this prompt.

When I switch to ssh-based repo url my key works correctly for the mentioned operations.

 

!auth-service__Git_.png!
fields.summary: Version 2.4 (78) with Github Enterprise: Unable to authenticate

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Window menu and notice the shortcut key for the "Open Repository Browser" (it's CMS + O)
 # Close the menu again
 # Press CMD + O

*Actual result: *

The "File > Open..." dialog appears (because it is also assigned the CMD + O shortcut).

*Expected result: *

The "Open Repository Browser" should have a different, unique shortcut key so that it's possible to open it using the keyboard.

*Additional notes:*

The problem was introduced quite some time ago. Before that, the Open Repository Browser had a different shortcut key.
fields.summary: Wrong (duplicate) shortcut key for "Show Repository Browser"

fields.summary: Save the window tab settings

fields.description:
It is rather difficult to enter authentication credentials when the user interface is presented behind some other windows and thus cannot accept input focus.

STR:
 # Put SourceTree full screen.
 # Open preferences.
 # Visit Accounts tab.
 # Attempt to modify Oauth credentials for an account.

Observe that the sheet opens behind, and is inaccessible.

Workaround: drag the prefs window to a different “space” (display).
fields.summary: Credentials sheet opens behind the prefs window in fullscreen

fields.description: Currently there is no indication that "Refresh Remote Status" has completed. Adding UI to show this is in progress, or has completed, would be very helpful to avoid confusion and provide clarity when checking out a remote, branching, or merging - especially if a remote is very slow to refresh.
fields.summary: Add blocking dialogue when refreshing remote repository

fields.description:
When selecting a lot of files to stage (using CMD+A), even though I set Preferences->Diff->Ignore File patterns to * . *, it takes a while waiting for SourceTree (which is locked while processing) to finish trying to build previews, to then just display "Diff was suppressed because of file size or pattern" for each file. Moreover, when it finishes, the diff view fills up for just a friction of a second, gets cleared again, and seems like it processes the files again for the second time.

 

Could not upload Mov file to JIRA: "JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again."

 

So here's a link to the video:

[https://www.wetransfer.com/downloads/c3d914c150234548893f0476a3e32deb20161121133615/b164caa74758bedd894258a59eacffad20161121133615/6c7193]

 

Admin should download video and attach it to this bug, because wetransfer links expire after a week.
fields.summary: Diff window locks app while processing files which should not be processed

fields.description:
In sourcetree 2.3.1 mac os 10.11.6, the application repeatedly hung when trying to reset multiple altered files in one go. 
I found that the problem was that I recently changed my settings from 25 lines of context to 6. Sourcetree could not handle that.
I resetted them one by one and changed the setting back to 25.
The files concerned were jsons, used in a dictionary context.
fields.summary: Sourcetree hangs

fields.description: SourceTree Beta.app (2.4b6) now uses the default (stable) icon.
fields.summary: Beta app icon with red ribbon lost

fields.description:
Source Tree and Bitbucket e-mail addresses are not in sync. All repositories I have are shared with my address linked to the Bitbucket account, and for some reason my old work e-mail address is used in Source Tree when committing code.

Can you please check why those two e-mail addresses are not in sync?
fields.summary: Incorrect e-mail address

fields.description:
SourceTree losing scrolling position if you are performing changes in staging area.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open repository with changes.
 # Select file with unstaged changes.
 # Scroll down changes view.
 # Stage/Discard Hunk/Lines.

*Expected Result:*

Changes view will stay in the same place where user performed staging operation.

*Actual Result:*

Changes view are scrolled to the top. User need to scroll once again.
fields.summary: SourceTree loses scrolling position when making changes in staging area

fields.description:
"ancestor order" produces an accurate ancestry tree.

"date order" shows commits in the same order (which is probably correct in this case) but produces a bizarre ancestry tree, drawing lines from some recent commits to off the bottom of the list.

I would attach screenshots, but: "JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. " (areyoukiddingmeface)

 

I see a similar bug recorded at "low" priority for old versions of Sourcetree. It's still around.
fields.summary: Correct tree is displayed only in ancestor order; date order produces a bizarre tree with no relationship to reality

fields.description: The error can be reproduced everytime I open SourceTree fresh, and do not have FileMerge yet opened. I have my SourceTree configured to use FileMerge as my diff tool. I then make changes to a file and view them as modified within SourceTree. I select select the modified file within SourceTree and press CMD + D to launch the diff tool (FileMerge). It launches and I view my changes. I then close the FileMerge window (not closing the app entirely - there's a difference on a Mac). When I go back to SourceTree after closing the FileMerge window, SourceTree just hangs (spinner cursor). I have to restart SourceTree for it to work again. Side note, FileMerge will also hang and will have to be Force Quit. This happens to me on a daily basis, so it is a very real issue.
fields.summary: Error with FileMerge

fields.description: The error can be reproduced everytime I open SourceTree fresh, and do not have FileMerge yet opened. I have my SourceTree configured to use FileMerge as my diff tool. I then make changes to a file and view them as modified within SourceTree. I select select the modified file within SourceTree and press CMD + D to launch the diff tool (FileMerge). It launches and I view my changes. I then close the FileMerge window (not closing the app entirely - there's a difference on a Mac). When I go back to SourceTree after closing the FileMerge window, SourceTree just hangs (spinner cursor). I have to restart SourceTree for it to work again. Side note, FileMerge will also hang and will have to be Force Quit. This happens to me on a daily basis, so it is a very real issue.
fields.summary: Error with FileMerge

fields.description:
received the App System Error bug warning that the file descriptor issue was an OS bug

radar://[10257191|http://openradar.appspot.com/10257191]

Warning said that only fix was an OS reboot.

Force Quit and restarted source tree. Issue is completely gone. Can not reproduce. 

Did not require restarting Mac.
fields.summary: File descriptor system error may not be OS issue anymore

fields.description: You can see diff direction is always from feature to master (git diff feature..master). But sometimes it's needed to see diff from master to feature (git diff master..feature)
fields.summary: Support for diff direction

fields.description:
In SourceTree's preferences panel, you can specify Terminal, iTerm and iTerm2 as terminal apps to open when clicking the toolbar button.

I'd like to be able to specify Cathode, another terminal emulator. See [http://www.secretgeometry.com/apps/cathode/] for details on this app

 

 

Thanks
fields.summary: Please allow Cathode as a terminal application

fields.description:
Using Branch-> Delete branches feature I had like a lot of branches to clean up (around 120). After selecting one by one (i needed to check the checkbox, using space didn't work to select an item) the confirmation dialog didn't fit in the screen, so couldn't see the OK button. I was lucky that the default was OK and I hit enter so the process could start.

I am using SourceTree on mac, version 2.3.2 (75)

1. Could you make the branches list scroll and the dialog to have an predefined size and maybe resizable for those who don't like scroll.

2. Could you make the branch selection available by hitting the spacebar on the keyboard so i could navigate the list purely from the keyboard.
fields.summary: Scrolling in branch list doesn't work

fields.description:
When you click on a stash on the sidebar, a diff of each file is directly presented in a vertically stacked view. This makes it difficult to know which files have been modified, especially if the stash contains many files or files with many changes.

It would be nice to have a list with the files in the stash. It would be even better to have a view like File Status View, where you can select the files which you want to diff. This would also make clicking on a stash perform better since the entire diff doesn't need to be shown right away.

Thanks
fields.summary: Improve stash view
Error Encountered while Staging/Discard  some lines in Git

fields.description: If we delete a origin branch directly on Github, the Sourcetree can't aware that the branch has been deleted and it still shows inside my REMOTES/origin. Also 'refresh remotes' doesn't work.
fields.summary: Remotes branches don't disappear after deleted them directly on GitHub

fields.description:
I have the following line in my .gitattributes file

*.m diff=objc

*.mm diff=objc

 

This causes "git diff" on the command line to show the affected function name in the hunk header of objective-C code changes. It would be great if this could also be exposed within the SourceTree UI's diff viewer panel.

 

Many thanks

Mark
fields.summary: Including function names in the diff viewer

fields.description:
1) Removing icons so that nobody can add them back doesn't decrease interface bloat, it just removes some features from people who wanted them. (The proper solution is to remove them from the default set.)
 2) Making icons "modern" does nothing to decrease interface bloat (but nor does it hurt — it's just unrelated).
 3) Making icons smaller doesn't decrease interface bloat and it does increase pain.
 4) Making icons indistinguishable from each other definitely doesn't decrease interface bloat and it increases pain a lot. This is the reason that your current release is unusable.

Let's talk about the last one. I'm sure you have designers who are better artists than me and I did the attached icons in <5 minutes. They are still modern, they in the exact same style you're using, but they actually look different from one another. And they're my free gift to you. If was up to me, I'd also provide a larger option too, but at least make the icons you have look different from each other.

I'm one of the people who paid for SourceTree for my whole company before it was free. I like it, but you've done a number of things to make it worse after the Atlassian acquisition. You've fixed some of the other mistakes. Can you please fix the icons?
fields.summary: Feature request: Change icons
teste

fields.description:
Beginning with version 2.3.2, the diff viewer now resets its scroll position when ever SourceTree refreshes. This occurs when files are updated (per the setting in preferences), when staging or unstaging a file, hunk, or some lines, and when manually refreshing from View > Refresh or cmd+R.

This is especially problematic when staging changes one hunk at a time, as you lose your place in the diff viewer every time you stage anything. This makes the task of staging only some changes considerably more time consuming and error prone.

The bug is a near-constant headache as it occurs every time you use the diff viewer (whether staging or not, whenever the program refreshes).
fields.summary: Diff view loses scroll position after refresh

fields.description: I need to add button in create issue screen. That button will hide and show some of the fields.
fields.summary: Button in screen

fields.description:
Исх сост - программа запущена, есть  непустые поля на стр "рацион" и стр "продукты",

Открыта стр "продукты"

1.Печать

ФР - программа закрывается

ОР - иконка выбора принтера
fields.summary: 5.при попытке печати стр "ПРОДУКТЫ" программа закрывается

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:
 # Open "Repository" menu
 # Click "Git LFS" sub-menu
 # Click "Track / Untrack files" item
 # Click the "+" button to add one entry to the list
(in my case the list starts empty, but I don't think it makes any difference)
 # A call-out box appears where the user is asked to either type the extension of the files to be tracked with Git LFS, or to choose it from a drop-down menu.
 # DON'T open the drop-down menu, only type the extension (for example "lib", or "*.lib")
 # Click the OK button

*Expected result*:

The new extension should be added to the list

*Actual result*:

A dialog window appears complaining that "You must type or select an extension to add.", even if the extension was actually typed.

*Additional notes:*

While writing this report I noticed two workarounds:
 # At step #7, if instead of clicking the "OK" button I press the return key on the keyboard, then the extension is correctly accepted and added to the list as expected.
 # At step #6, if I open and then close the drop down menu before typing the extension, even without selecting anything from the list, then pressing the "OK" button correctly adds the typed extension to the list, as expected
fields.summary: Malfunction in Git LFS -> Track / Untrack files menu command
"Full console output" popup doesn't remember window size

fields.description:
# открываем программу.
 # File- Синхронизация - регистрация - ввод персональных данных (пользователь "Алекс1962", пароль "маша", E-mail "aleksa.korolev@gmail.com"
 # повторно File- Синхронизация

ФР - синхронизация не выполнена

ОР - выполнение синхронизации, изменение данных на личном аккаунте
fields.summary: невозможно синхронизировать программу после регистрации

fields.description:
Keyboard shortcut for "Show Repository Browser" got broken in release 2.3.1 and it's still broken on 2.3.2

The original shortcut was Cmd-B, but now it's Cmd-O which collides with "Open..." action.

Please fix the shortcut by assigning it back to Cmd-B.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Show Repository Browser keyboard shortcut is broken

fields.description:
When merging and selecting a commit that has not yet been pulled into a local branch, but is on a tracking branch (e.g. "origin/develop"), Sourcetree will create a commit message stating the commit hash, not the tracking branch. Only if the local develop branch had been previously been updated will it say "Merge branch 'develop' into..." This is somewhat of an inconvenience, because the hash there is nigh on useless (the hash is right there in the metadata if you need it, the log message is supposed to be more meaningful to humans).

The workaround I've been using is first checking out develop, pulling, and then going back to the feature branch to do the merge. Another workaround I came accross (in -SRCTREEWIN-492-) is to find the remote branch in the left pane and select "Pull  [remote branch] into [current local branch]". This produces a somewhat more useful log message, although its a little verbose for my taste, expanding the remote into the actual location (I.e. merged 'develop' from [http://github.com/[...]] into [current local branch]). The workflow isn't as nice as selecting "Merge" and picking  the merge point from the history, though, so you can be sure the branch you're merging is at the point you thought it was.
fields.summary: Use tracking branch name in merge commit message

fields.description:
After updating to 2.3.2 this morning, I've noticed staging a commit has become a pain.

The panel with "hunks" on the bottom right keeps refreshing every three seconds or so (takes about a second each time) and resets the scroll to top. This makes selecting hunks down low in a file with many changes almost impossible.

After staging a hunk a similar slow refresh is done, also resetting the scroll position to the top.

I already tried restarting and closing my IDE (xcode in this case)
fields.summary: Worse performance in commit staging since 2.3.2 (75)

fields.description:
While trying to commit a sub-module, I was prompted to enter my username and email address. When I click OK, the prompt comes right back. When I click cancel, the commit window stays on screen, but I can't do anything. If I click the commit dialog box, the prompt for password comes back.

This leaves the UI in a dead end state, the only way to recover is to _force quit_ SourceTree and restart. Pressing the escape key does not help, and using the quit menu option just causes a beep.

See the attached animated GIF.

!DeadEndUp.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Dead-End UI trying to commit sub module

fields.description:
When you delete a branch there's a time lag between interface unlocking after branch deletion and interface rerendering without the branch.

If you click right mouse button on sidebar menu items in that time, the interface will rerender but the context menu will still remain at the same position and have the same items, but affect inappropriate item.

For some items the app silently fails, for others in will output some error.
fields.summary: Delay after branch deletion allows to call context menu action on inappropriate items

fields.description:
It would be awesome (and helpfull) if the commit history timeine would render emojis instead of the :emoji: thing.

See attachment. I want a gun emoji to show up there as we use it to indicate that a npm install is required.

 

Thanks and props for a great product!
fields.summary: Emoji rendering support in Sourctree commit history view

fields.description:
For some reason, when the remote has commits not in the local tree, SourceTree shows the number+arrows but has no easy way to fetch that branch without checking it out. On the terminal I can do "git fetch origin develop:develop" to update it without checking it out - making merges easier.

Doing this using Custom Actions should be simple, however there is no support for Custom Actions on branches and there is no replacement variables for this case.

Right clicking on a branch/feature name should have the custom actions menu and custom actions should have a %b (or something similar) to carry the branch name.
fields.summary: Branch Custom Actions

fields.description:
From a customer:

"hey hey, been struggling with the slow performance of sourcetree when a repo has a large number of branches. I did some analysis and looks like sourcetree is doing tons of nsstring comparisons in a background thread while the main is waiting (not blocked) for a long time. So switching branches takes like 8-10secs, back to termimal

Version 2.3.1 (69), 5000 branches"
fields.summary: Switching branches takes a long time for repos with large number of branches
Dev a web portal for e commerce

fields.description: When changing the repo on a pull (to pull from upstream), it would be nice if SourceTree would preserve the branch name, assuming it exists in both repos.
fields.summary: Preserve branch when changing repo on pull, if possible

fields.description: When selected more than 1 repository in main window (Cmd + Click to select more than one) and trying to delete them, SpurceTree crashes.
fields.summary: Crash on deleting multiple repos

Open app
Go to the tab recipes
Click on the button add new recipe
Do not fill the name field and save
Expected result: error
Actual result: Saved
fields.summary: Empty name

fields.description:
# Open app
# Go to the tab recipes
# Click on the button add new recipe
# Fill only weight box 
Expected result: I seen error "Run time library"
Actual result: I seen error "Fill in all the fields"
fields.summary: Runtime library

fields.description:
*Precoditions: ПК с доступом в Интернет*
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Зайти на сайт [http://bezumno.ru/]
 # В правом верхнем углу нажать на кнопку "+RSS на E-mail"

*Actual result*
Откроется новая страница со следующим сообщением:
This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below.
<rss xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" version="2.0">
<channel>
<title>Сайт приколов - Безумно.ру</title>
<link>[http://bezumno.ru/]</link>
<language>ru</language>
<description>Сайт приколов - Безумно.ру</description>
<generator>DataLife Engine</generator>
<item>
<title>RSS in offline mode</title>
<guid isPermaLink="true"/>
<link/>
<description>RSS in offline mode</description>
<category>undefined</category>
<dc:creator>DataLife Engine</dc:creator>
<pubDate>DataLife Engine</pubDate>
</item>
</channel>
</rss>

*Expected result*
После нажатия на кнопку "+RSS на E-mail" должно открываться новое окно браузера с полем ввода имейла.
fields.summary: На главной странице при нажатии на кнопку "+RSS на E-mail" выдаёт ошибку с XML file

fields.description:
When doing an external diff with FileMerge (may happen with other apps as well), SourceTree will hang if FileMerge isn't already running. This is 100% reproducible:
 # In Preferences, select FileMerge as the visual diff tool.
 # Make sure FileMerge is not already running.
 # Do an external diff, which will launch FileMerge.

*Result:* SourceTree will hang (beachball) until you quit FileMerge – closing the file window will not suffice.

*Expected result:* SourceTree should continue to respond and operate independently of FileMerge.

*Workaround:* In Xcode, launch FileMerge manually (Xcode->Open Developer Tool->FileMerge) before doing an external diff. If it's already running, the hang won't occur.

*Suspected cause:* SourceTree launches the external diff application _synchronously_ and must therefore wait until it exits. It should be launched _asynchronously_.
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs when launching external diff (FileMerge)

fields.description:
SourceTree hangs in a manner very consistent with -----SRCTREE-2068----- in which user believed they had to force quit, but this bug is definitely not resolved and involves External Diff

The hangs can seem periodic/arbitrary due to a delay effect, but bug is reliably reproduced by:
 1. Right click file in pending or posted changeset and select External Diff from menu
 2. FileMerge is launched (default merge tool, hasn't been changed - no others installed to test with)
 3. Within about 10 to 15 seconds but no sooner than 5, SourceTree will become unresponsive, showing the pinwheel icon.
 4. SourceTree will remain unresponsive until immediately after FileMerge is fully exited. Closing the individual diff view has no effect. Opening and/or closing multiple diffs has no effect. Without quitting FileMerge, SourceTree has to be killed.

I think due to the delay, and given that users are very likely to move from the diff to editing code, and later coming back to SourceTree, it is easy to see how the issue could be diagnosed as intermittent or attributed to random other factors.
fields.summary: Hangs on External Diff until external app is fully quit
